title: Marine Insurance

benefits.description: Protection from all risk during transit
Coverage for rail, road, air & sea

WhatMarin.title: What is Marine Insurance?
WhatMarin.subtitle: What is marine insurance?
WhatMarin.paragraph: Marine insurance is a type of general insurance policy that covers ships, cargo, and other vessels against losses suffered while in transit. It offers financial protection for damages sustained due to natural or man-made disasters of various kinds. The coverage provided by a marine insurance policy may include perils such as fire, piracy, theft, collision and natural calamities like hurricanes, storms, etc.

whyImportantHeadingCenter.whyImportantDescription: A marine insurance policy is essential because of the following reasons:

whyImportant.title: Protection Against Losses
whyImportant.description: Marine insurance offers financial protection against potential losses that your shipment may incur during transit. It helps minimise the economic impact of these losses.

whyImportant.title: Helps in Business Stability
whyImportant.description: The proceeds from a marine insurance policy help a business to regain its footing and provide stability.

whyImportant.title: Compliance With Legal Requirements
whyImportant.description: Many countries require vessels and shippers to mandatorily have marine insurance under the Marine Insurance Act.

whyImportant.title: Helps in Risk Management
whyImportant.description: Shipowners and cargo owners can effectively manage risk with a marine insurance policy.

howWork.title: How does marine insurance work?
howWork.subtitle: Here’s the working of a marine insurance policy
steps: You buy a marine insurance policy from an insurance company. The policy outlines what's covered and what's not, along with other terms and conditions.
You pay premium to the insurance company. The premium amount depends on the value of cargo, route, and nature of the cargo.
The policy is active for a specific period. It can cover a single trip or multiple trips over time depending on the policy chosen.
In case of loss or damage during transit, you notify the insurance company, fill out the claims form and provide the necessary documentation.
The insurance company assesses your claims and the extent of damage. Once approved, you receive compensation as per the policy's terms and conditions.

features.featuresTitle: What are the features of marine insurance?
features.featuresSubtitle: Given below are some features of marine insurance:

features.title: Coverage for various modes of transport
features.description: A marine insurance policy offers coverage for various modes of transport, including sea, air, roads and railways. This versatility ensures complete protection across transportation modes.

features.title: Various types of policies
features.description: Open Inland, Open Import/ Export, Single Transit inland, Single Transit Import/ Export are the various types of marine insurance policies. Each of them has distinct features.

features.title: Coverage as per global standards
features.description: A marine insurance policy governed by the Marine Insurance Act offers coverage according to global standards (INCO terms). This means that when you transport cargo internationally, you can use the policy to suit your needs.

typesOfPolicies.typesOMIDescreption: The various types of marine insurance are as follows:

typesOfPolicies.title: Marine open insurance
typesOfPolicies.description: It offers coverage for your cargo in transit for a year. Also known as a floating policy, it saves you from the hassle of buying an individual policy for every consignment.

typesOfPolicies.title: Marine single transit insurance
typesOfPolicies.description: It offers coverage for cargo between points of origin and the financial destination. It covers losses from fire, explosions, accidents, thefts, weather events, etc.

typesOfPolicies.title: Marine inland insurance
typesOfPolicies.description: It offers coverage for cargo within India from natural and man-made perils.

typesOfPolicies.title: Marine import and export insurance
typesOfPolicies.description: While marine import insurance covers cargo transported from a foreign country to India, a marine export policy offers coverage for cargo transported from India to a foreign country.

whoShouldBuy.title: Who should buy marine insurance?
whoShouldBuy.description: Given below are some individuals and businesses who need marine insurance:

coverage.title: What’s covered in ICICI Lombard’s Marine Insurance?
coverage.description: ICICI Lombard’s marine insurance provides coverage for losses arising due to:

coverage: Total loss of package overboard during loading/unloading

notCovered.title: Whats not covered in ICICI Lombards Marine Insurance?
notCovered.description: Coverage is not provided in case of:

notCovered: Inherent vice or nature of the subject-matter insured
Ordinary leakage, ordinary loss in weight or volume or ordinary wear and tear of the subject-matter insured
Insolvency or financial default of owner, manager, charters or operators of the vessel
Any other risk specifically excluded in the policy

faq.heading: Frequently asked questions - Marine insurance policy

items.question: What is the duration of marine insurance?
items.answer: It differs across policies. While some policies may cover only one trip, others may offer coverage for multiple trips in a year.

items.question: How is the premium calculated for marine insurance?
items.answer: The premium depends on the cargo type, route availed and the value of cargo, among others.

items.question: What is the function of marine insurance?
items.answer: Marine insurance offers financial protection in case cargo get damaged during transit due to natural or man-made disasters.

items.question: What factors should be taken into account while buying marine insurance?
items.answer: Determine the type of coverage needed, policy inclusions and exclusion, premium and deductibles and insurer's reputation before buying a marine insurance plan.
